Lay
Bighteenth,
1 9
2 7.
W. H. Howard Estate Co.,
Sharon Blage,
San Francisco.
Gentlemen:
The City of San Francisco for some time past has been
endeavoring to
secure a suitable tract of land for municipal air
port purposes.
We had under investigation sites at South San Francisco,
Millbrae,
South of San Mateo and lands under water at San Mateo
Point
easterly of your property.
We found that it would be
impracticable to select a permanent site until we had gathered
sufficient
data
data in regara to the fog and wind conditions, as this
is not available at the present time.
We finally leased from the Mills Estate a temporary field
for a period of three years, with the privilege of extension of an
additional two years.
It is our
idea to establish small meteorological stations
on or near sites under contemplation, and to ascertain the rog and
wind
conditions over a period of twelve months.
The work will be
in charge
of
men assigned to us by the United States Weather Bureau.
We
contemplate
the
construction of the necessary buildings immediately
and the period of observation would extend from July 1, 1927 to June
We are desirous of securing permission from your Company
to locate one of take at 07, ad would apprectate very much
accompanying
securing permission from your Company.
cola be perm relocable on thirty days, notice in the event of the
sale of the property,
and we would remove iron your property the
building when we vacated the same.
I am also enclosing map marked file A-7732, giving full
details of
the location and construction work.
Thanking you in advance for any courtesies you may extend
to us in this matter, I am
Very truly yours,
JJP:KH
RIGHT OF WAY AGENT.

properties.sfomuseum:description: Facsimile of correspondence from Joseph J. Phillips, Right of Way Agent for City and County of San Francisco, to W. H. Howard Estate Company, dated May 18, 1927, concerning request to install meteorological station in conjunction with lease of Mills Estate property in San Mateo County for use as airport; file copy, not signed or mailed.
properties.wof:name: correspondence: Joseph J. Phillips, Right of Way Agent for City and County of San Francisco
